title: Jesu My Lord My God My All

author.name: Henry Collins
author.bio: Henry Collins was an English Catholic priest and hymn writer known for his deep devotion and contribution to Catholic hymnody. His hymns, characterized by their personal piety and love for Jesus, reflect Collins' own spiritual journey and commitment to his faith. 'Jesu My Lord My God My All' is among his most beloved hymns, expressing a profound adoration for Jesus and a desire to grow in love and devotion. Collins' work continues to inspire worshippers with its heartfelt expression of faith and dedication to the divine.

lyrics:
Jesu, my Lord, my God, my All,
Hear me, blest Saviour, when I call;
Hear me, and from Thy dwelling-place
Pour down the riches of Thy grace.

CHORUS:
Jesu, my Lord, I Thee adore,
Oh, make me love Thee more and more.

Jesu, too late I Thee have sought,
How can I love Thee as I ought?
And how extol Thy matchless fame,
The glorious beauty of Thy name?

Jesu, what didst Thou find in me,
That Thou hast dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou hast brought,
So far exceeding hope or thought.

Jesu, of Thee shall be my song,
To Thee my heart and soul belong;
All that I have or am is Thine,
And Thou, blest Saviour, Thou art mine.
